newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: IAWS says acquisition to assist in growth.
newsitem.headline: IAWS says acquisition to assist in growth.

text.p: Irish agri-business company IAWS Group Plc said on Thursday that its recent acquisition of a 45 percent shareholding in French fertiliser company Cedest will provide further growth opportunities for the firm.

"This investment will be earnings enhancing and we believe the geographic expansion of our operations into continental Europe will bring further opportunity for us to grow," chief executive Philip Lynch said after the annual meeting.
Lynch said France was the largest consumer of fertilisers in Europe, accounting for over 12 million tonnes per annum or over 25 percent of total EU fertilisers.
It is also the largest cereal market in Europe producing over 30 percent of total EU cereal output, he said.
"Cedest is a major French producer and we believe the association with IAWS will benefit the company," Lynch said.
"Cedest management will be involved in our fertiliser executive team which plans our strategic investment programmes," he added.

Lynch said IAWS had a balanced earning stream operating in Ireland and the UK in the agri-food sector and that as highly specialist niche operators, the group had grown only in sectors where it could demonstrate some competitive advantage.
